top_categories.workout_context: Wild Horse Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Wild Horse Gravel’s high desert gravel, canyon roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Wild Horse Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Wild Horse Gravel’s high desert gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Racing Wild Horse Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Wild Horse Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Wild Horse Gravel’s high desert gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Wild Horse Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The varied gradients at Wild Horse Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Wild Horse Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Wild Horse Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Wild Horse Gravel’s 3,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Wild Horse Gravel’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Wild Horse Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Wild Horse Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high desert gravel to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel, canyon roads, western colorado.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 62 miles of high desert gravel in De Beque, Colorado.
